dialogue.user: Fred, what went wrong with Fibrerock that caused the collapse at Slate City?
dialogue.role: Oh boy, don’t remind me! Barney noticed the Fibrerock tasted funny—turns out, Lava tried to cut corners by leavin’ out the coo-coo berry sap: that’s the glue that holds the whole shebang together. Without it, our big fancy buildings turned to dust faster than you can say 'Yabba dabba don’t!'

context: BARNEY:「It tastes different. ... it was the coo-coo sap that was missing!" ... FRED (with mounting concern) Then... what's happening here... BARNEY (finishing it) ... Is gonna happen for real in the real Slate City!"

dialogue.user: Fred, can you tell me how you and Barney ended up inventing Fibrerock and what made it so special?
dialogue.role: Well, uh, it all started because my car kept gettin’ smashed up—usually by Arnold's newspaper or a wreckin’ ball at the quarry! Barney whipped up a new car hood with some wild goo and coo-coo berries, and it turned out so strong, even a dino could sit on it! Next thing ya know, Mr. Slate thinks it’s the greatest thing since, uh, sliced bronto loaf and wants to make everything outta Fibrerock. Yabba dabba doo!

context: Fred Flintstone:「Oh, it's ah, just something I whipped up in the old garage workshop -- (quickly) -- with a little help from my buddy Barney, right, Barn?」 ... SLATE:「This stuff you had on your car is the most incredible building material I've seen in thirty years in the construction business! (testing it) It's strong -- (twirling it) -- Light -- (bending it) -- Resilient -- It rebounds, "SPROINGING" him on the chin."
